Articles.Content: Just noting that if this were on GeForce Now I would have bought it right away. As it is, I probabaly won't get around to doing so for three or four years, which is a shame for me.

I was just searching online to see if KSP2 will be on GFN. Sad to hear there hasn't been any movement on this. I don't have a PC that can play it and I can't justify a new PC just for this game so I am in the same boat as you. I would have bought it by now if it was on GFN.

Why would an early access game in a beta state be on a service like GeForce now?

It seems to be running on a few game/remote-streaming services but ive never heard of them - but that doesnt mean much since i dont care about that:

https://www.pcmag.com/reviews/shadow-by-blade

Take it as you will but you should seriously inform yourself before using them - i doubt that an early access game will run well. And its probably more like a remote PC that streams to your PC but you have to inform yourself - i have no idea.

Edited March 2, 2023 by Moons

+1

I'll surely buy KSP2 and all DLCs that will follow if its available on GFN. If not, I'll sadly won't buy it, not willing to buy new hardware. I've moved to cloud gaming.

On 3/2/2023 at 6:39 PM, Moons said:

Why would an early access game in a beta state be on a service like GeForce now?

There are other Early Access games on GeforceNow.

+1

I love KSP, but need it to be on a service like GeForce Now (my favorite) for this to accessible to me. If the KSP team can get it working there, I'll buy immediately!
GeForce Now: I do not have extra RTX4090 resources to share with you!

Guys, I think it's time we come clean about something. Some of us are Mac KSP players because, well, the M1 chip can perform better than the minimun or recommend system requirements. Sure, the graphics card is a little worse but it's great. So I think KSP2 should be available on Geforce NOW for a little while until Mac support rolls around. Because Parrellels is $99 and some of that money might be better spent on a better PC. So, I wonder if this is feasible. My YouTube channel has been kinda dying after I posted no KSP2 content, and I think all us mac users would be happy with KSP2 on Nvidia Geforce NOW

KSP was on GFN but was removed a long long time ago, and there has been no indication of ever going back(legal hiccup maybe?).    Perhaps when KSP2 hits 1.0 they’ll reconsider it  

 

Merged with overlapping thread
